text.section: A corporation shall hold a meeting of shareholders annually at a time stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws.

Annual shareholders' meetings may be held in or out of this state at the place stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws. If no place is stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws, annual meetings shall be held at the corporation's principal office.
The failure to hold an annual meeting at the time stated in or fixed in accordance with a corporation's bylaws shall not affect the validity of any corporate action.

law.history: Created 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 23, sec. 49, effective January 1, 1989.
